meanings.sent1: The rubber band was souple enough to stretch around the box.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's body was souple, allowing her to perform impressive stunts.
meanings.sent3: The souple tree branches danced in the wind, looking like they were doing a waltz.
meanings.sent4: Her souple mind could adapt to new ideas effortlessly, like a river flowing around obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The souple fabric draped elegantly over the chair, showing off its flexibility.

meanings.definition: Capable of being easily bent or flexed.
meanings.sent1: The straw was souple enough to bend without snapping.
meanings.sent2: The wire was souple, allowing the artist to create intricate shapes.
meanings.sent3: The souple ruler played a prank by bending itself when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His souple excuses twisted and turned, trying to avoid the truth like a slippery eel.
meanings.sent5: The souple branches of the willow tree swayed gracefully in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: The plastic fork was souple enough to scoop up the salad without snapping.
meanings.sent2: The reed was souple, allowing the wind to sway it gently.
meanings.sent3: The souple straw contorted itself into a funny shape, surprising the child.
meanings.sent4: Her souple will bent but never broke under the pressure, like a resilient tree in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The souple wire twisted easily into intricate designs, showing its flexibility.
